content.question: Why were works like the one on the right far more popular with the nineteenth-century public and with critics than those painted by artists of the movement represented on the left?

frqParts.text: Why were works like the one on the right far more popular with the nineteenth-century public and with critics than those painted by artists of the movement represented on the left?

topic.text: 4.2: Purpose and Audience in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
